actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A resolution expressing the sense of the House with respect to the immediate removal of certain regulations unilaterally put in place by the European Economic Community which have the effect of damaging and interfering with historic and acceptable trade patterns in the U.S. exports of dried prunes, and efforts made to restrict exports of walnuts to the EEC, and action taken by the United States if such import regulations are not immediately removed and if additional unilateral regulations are instituted.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the President of the United States should use all means at his disposal to obtain removal of trade barriers imposed on imports of American dried prunes by European Economic Community countries, and that the member countries be placed on notice that corresponding retaliatory measures will be taken if similar restrictions are placed on imports of American walnuts.

titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the House with respect to the immediate removal of certain regulations unilaterally put in place by the European Economic Community which have the effect of damaging and interfering with historic and acceptable trade patterns in the U.S. exports of dried prunes, and efforts made to restrict exports of walnuts to the EEC, and action taken by the United States if such import regulations are not immediately removed and if additional unilateral regulations are instituted.
